exercises.name: Go for a Run
exercises.description: A natural way to boost mood, reduce stress, and improve overall mental and physical well-being.
exercises.equipment: Running shoes (optional: fitness tracker or smartwatch)
instructions: Choose a safe and comfortable running route, such as a park or trail.
Wear breathable clothing and proper running shoes for support.
Start with a warm-up by walking or stretching for 5 minutes.
Begin running at a comfortable pace, focusing on steady breathing.
Maintain good posture and relax your shoulders while running.
Run for 10-30 minutes depending on your fitness level and comfort.
Cool down with a few minutes of walking and post-run stretching.

exercises.name: Lift Some Weights
exercises.description: Strength training can help boost mood, reduce anxiety, and improve overall mental and physical health.
exercises.equipment: Dumbbells, kettlebells, or resistance bands (optional: barbell, weight machines)
instructions: Choose a weight that is challenging but manageable for your fitness level.
Start with a 5-minute warm-up, including dynamic stretching or light cardio.
Perform compound exercises such as squats, deadlifts, or bench presses.
Focus on controlled movements and proper form to avoid injury.
Breathe consistently—inhale when lowering the weight, exhale when lifting.
Complete 3-4 sets of 8-12 reps per exercise, depending on your goal.
Cool down with stretching or foam rolling to relax muscles and prevent soreness.

exercises.name: Combine Yoga With Other Treatments
exercises.description: Enhancing yoga practice by integrating it with other treatments like therapy, meditation, and a healthy lifestyle can maximize mental and physical well-being.
exercises.equipment: Yoga mat (optional: meditation cushion, therapy sessions, wellness plan)
instructions: Incorporate yoga into your daily routine along with therapy or counseling.
Combine yoga with mindfulness meditation to deepen relaxation and focus.
Pair yoga with physical exercise such as walking, running, or strength training.
Maintain a balanced diet to support both mental and physical health.
Ensure consistency in practice—try yoga at least 3-4 times a week.
Listen to your body and modify poses or techniques as needed.
Seek professional guidance if combining yoga with medical treatments.

exercises.name: Relieve Stress With Graceful Tai Chi Moves
exercises.description: A gentle, flowing movement practice that promotes relaxation, reduces stress, and improves balance and focus.
instructions: Find a quiet and open space where you can move freely.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and arms relaxed.
Begin with deep breathing, focusing on slow and steady inhales and exhales.
Perform gentle, flowing movements such as ‘Wave Hands Like Clouds’ or ‘Grasp the Sparrow’s Tail.’
Move slowly and mindfully, coordinating your breath with each motion.
Maintain a soft focus and stay present in the moment.
Practice for 10-30 minutes, gradually increasing duration as you become comfortable.

exercises.name: Get a Healthy Dose of Sunlight
exercises.description: Exposure to natural sunlight helps boost mood, regulate sleep, and increase vitamin D levels.
instructions: Step outside in the morning or early afternoon for optimal sunlight exposure.
Choose an open space like a park, garden, or balcony to soak in natural light.
Expose your face, arms, and legs for at least 10-30 minutes, depending on skin sensitivity.
Engage in a relaxing activity like walking, meditating, or stretching while enjoying the sunlight.
Use sunscreen if staying out for an extended period to protect your skin.
Maintain a regular routine of sun exposure to support mental and physical health.

exercises.name: Break Out of a Funk by Bouncing
exercises.description: Bouncing exercises, like jumping on a trampoline or doing jumping jacks, help boost energy, improve circulation, and lift your mood.
instructions: Find a safe, open space where you can move freely.
Start with a gentle warm-up, such as light jogging in place or arm circles.
If using a trampoline, begin with small bounces and gradually increase intensity.
Try simple bouncing exercises like jumping jacks, knee-high jumps, or rope skipping.
Maintain a steady rhythm and focus on deep breathing.
Continue bouncing for 5-10 minutes, adjusting intensity as needed.
Cool down with gentle stretching to relax your muscles.
